name: Software Engineer - eXp Realty
description: For notable achievements, I helped build scalable and high-performance frontend architectures for Zoocasa and eXp Realty, optimizing user experience across web and mobile platforms using React, React Native, and TypeScript. I also transformed design concepts into polished interfaces by collaborating with the design team, and implemented advanced features such as cookie-based personalization and GTM-driven analytics, driving engagement and user retention.

name: Software & Machine Learning Engineer - University of Waterloo's RoboHub
description: At the University of Waterloo, I collaborated with AirBoss on a computer vision and robotics project, where I engineered a machine learning model for edge detection on their proprietary rubber material using Python and PyTorch - marking a first-of-its-kind solution in North America. The system was deployed within a ROS environment, enabling LIDAR-equipped robotic arms to map elevated terrain and accurately detect material edges. In another project, I utilized SAM2 to segment white bags of powedered material, calculated precise location relative to a robotic arm to pick it up with 98% positioning precision.

name: QA Automation Engineer - Zoocasa & eXp Realty
description: As a QA Automation Engineer at Zoocasa, I boosted backend reliability by increasing the project's Golang test coverage from 30% to 73%, enhancing code quality and maintainability. I also reinforced frontend test infrastructure using Cypress and Playwright to ensure stability across key React components. Additionally, I optimized search and data parsing in MapKit with Elasticsearch, improving property listing speeds and delivering a smoother experience within the Apple Maps integration.

name: Software Engineer - Tuq Inc
description: I developed and documented 6 client-based projects and updated 3 older company projects throughout the Work Term. Each project contained 20+ models, updated with customer-requested features, and tested with 2500+ RSpec tests. I also designed 30+ emails per project, creating an automated environment for a seamless user experience. These projects leveraged RESTful APIs, guiding the user towards wanted features in an organized manner. 5 billing systems were also implemented using Moneris, allowing users the ability to purchase premium features within projects.

name: Software Engineer - Pinned
description: In my role as a member of a 5-person team, I actively employed MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js, Linear, and GitHub to contribute to the development of a dynamic news platform. This platform served as a showcase for organizational events tailored for subscribers, with a special emphasis on administrators facilitating these events. I took charge of engineering RESTful APIs, ensuring smooth communication between the front and back end. To validate our data model, I implemented Mocha tests, enhancing the robustness of our system. Engaging in code reviews, I played a key role in upholding coding standards, which not only facilitated comprehensive documentation but also streamlined our debugging processes.

name: Machine Learning & Software Engineer - Waterloo Aerial Robotics Group
description: I utilized a YoloV8 model training a drone to detect landing pads with 96% accuracy. Other tasks included creating an autonomous flight algorithm for path detections and other path calculations for unprecedented changes during a flight.

name: Technical Support Consultant - Renison University College
description: In managing the Jira system for classroom and office help requests, I introduced AI Automated Rules for Jira, Azure DevOps, and SharePoint, leading to a 45% increase in user satisfaction due to improved response accuracy. I also documented audio equipment usage, reducing related help requests by 30%, and optimized a Marking Tool in Microsoft Word using Visual Basic, cutting marking time for 70+ professors by half. These contributions collectively improved system efficiency and enhanced user experience.

name: Code Snippet Saver
description: I utilized JavaScript, HTML, Tailwind CSS, and GitHub to craft a feature-rich snippet management Chrome extension, enabling users to effortlessly save and organize code snippets. Leveraging the powerful features of Prism.js and Highlight.js, I intelligently color-coded the snippets, enhancing readability and offering a clearer understanding of syntax and code structure. By tapping into Chrome's local data storage system, I expanded support to over 250 programming languages, providing users with a versatile entry point to kickstart their coding journey with flexibility and ease.

name: Personal Portfolio
description: I worked on and updated the front-end aspects of this project for professional functionality while practicing efficient quality assurance for 3+ years.

name: 2023 Toyota Innovation Challenge
description: My team - 4 people including myself - placed first out of 40+ teams receiving the "Most Unique Approach" award in this challenge by Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada. We used OpenCV to develop an image-processing AI to detect sticker placement over holes on metallic surfaces. The algorithm was optimized to obtain a 99% success rate and run over live video feed achieving 30 fps.

name: Mentor - Math4me
description: I worked as a Math, Science, and English mentor to middle-school and high-school students who required assistance. I achieved 'Mentor of the Month' during my first month as a result of the hard work and dedication I had put into the job. After almost 3 years of working at Math4me, I have learned how to adapt and please different mindsets while convincing people - especially youth - to do what is right for them.

name: Competitions Organizor - MIST TORONTO
description: I helped recruit 70+ judges, moderators, and volunteers for high-school competitions - of all categories - to take place at the University of Toronto Saint George Campus. I completed this task with 100+ members in 6 months while attending bi-weekly meetings.

name: MIST (Muslim Interscholastic Tournament) Toronto Math Olympics
description: Achieved first place across all participating schools (in the Greater Toronto Area) in MIST Toronto's Math Olympics. This took almost 6 months of weekly exams and self-supervised tests as a practice to achieve.

name: International Math Tutor - Self Employed
description: I have been an entrepreneur for two years as I started my own tutoring business for international students - outside of Canada - and my own YouTube channel where I create more math videos to supplement my teaching.

name: Ontario Scholar
description: Achieved a grade of 80% at least six times in Grade 12 courses and graduated with an impressive 97% average from John Fraser Secondary School.

name: Deforestation Prevention Foundation
description: A group of 2 people - including myself - built a friendly website to educate 270+ students in our high school on ways to reduce the effects of deforestation. We presented reliable statistics and facts to spread information about the issue.

name: University of Waterloo - Math Contests
description:
Achieved top 25% out of all participants across the world in the following contests:
Pascal Contest (2018)
Cayley Contest (2019)
Fermat Contest (2020)
Canadian Senior Mathematics Contest (2020)
Canadian Senior Mathematics Contest (2021)

name: ASD-S Math Competition
description: Achieved first place with a team in a Mathematics Competition across all schools in the Anglophone South District - South (ASD-S) District at Saint John, New Brunswick.

name: GreyHound Hounds Honors
description: I achieved GreyHound Hounds Honors with a 95% average at Saint John High School during the 2018-2019 school year. I was also enrolled in an IB program which made this award much harder to achieve.
